summary: Email correspondence between a NYPD/FBI detective and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the issuance of a subpoena for Larry Visoski in July 2019. The email includes an attachment of the subpoena and mentions plans to meet in Florida.

persons.name: Larry Visoski

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Sends the attached subpoena for Larry Visoski and provides contact information, indicating coordination with law enforcement.

persons.role: NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: Requests the subpoena for Larry Visoski from the prosecutor, identified as part of a joint task force.

connections.description: Working together on a case involving Larry Visoski, with the detective requesting a subpoena and the prosecutor providing it.
The detective is involved in issuing a subpoena to Larry Visoski as part of an investigation.
The prosecutor is handling the subpoena process for Larry Visoski.

events.title: Subpoena issued for Larry Visoski
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney sends a subpoena for Larry Visoski to a NYPD/FBI detective, with plans to meet in Florida.

keyFacts: A subpoena was issued for Larry Visoski on July 9, 2019, as part of an investigation.
The communication involves a NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force detective and an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York.
The parties planned to meet in Florida, suggesting investigative activities or proceedings there.
The document indicates ongoing legal actions in the Epstein case in mid-2019, post-Epstein's arrest.
